item.title: Bluetooth simple one-line device connection pairing with Bluez
item.description: Hello, I’ve written a simple Python script using the Bluez (version 4.66) stack (thanks to http://shr-project.org/trac/wiki/Using) with this usage: python connect.py MACADDRESS PIN MOUNTPOINT Snippet code for connect.py is here. If the device is paired, it will be removed and unmounted. Disconnection is as easy with: python disconnect.py MACADDRESS MOUNTPOINT Snippet code for disconnect.py is here. Feel free to use the code also for other services, in this case my primary concern was to mount the file system.

item.title: Single app instances, Python and DBus
item.description: Hello, I’m working on FreeSpeak lately and I needed to run the application once per session, as it’s got a trayicon and a notebook (maybe windows with an applet is better?) I decided to use DBus for making the application run only a single instance; when you try to open it again it won’t start another process, instead it will use the already running one.
